scenario: Your lead developer demands a raise after launching a successful product.

choices.feedback: A bold move with big consequences.

scenario: A competitor offers to buy your company at a premium price.

choices.feedback: You cashed out, but your team is uneasy.
You get a better deal on your terms.

scenario: An employee is caught leaking internal documents to the press.
A global pandemic disrupts your supply chain.

choices.text: Cut losses and lay off staff
choices.feedback: You saved money but lost loyalty.

scenario: Your top manager is accused of harassment.
An investor wants you to implement a feature that goes against your ethics.

choices.feedback: You gained funding but lost face.

scenario: Employees demand a 4-day workweek.
You're invited to speak at a controversial tech conference.
Your company just won a major industry award.

choices.feedback: You're seen as a great leader.

choices.text: Use the moment to raise prices
choices.feedback: Profits rise, but so do complaints.

scenario: A famous influencer wants to partner, but they have a controversial history.

choices.feedback: You got visibility but also backlash.

choices.text: Wait and see how public reacts

scenario: Your lead AI engineer proposes an untested, potentially groundbreaking algorithm.

choices.feedback: High risk, high reward. The team is excited.

scenario: You are offered tax breaks to move operations overseas.

choices.feedback: Profit up, but staff and media react badly.

scenario: A data breach exposes customer information.

choices.feedback: A class action lawsuit is coming.

choices.text: Fix it silently and notify regulators only
choices.feedback: A legally safe but ethically gray move.

scenario: Your HR department proposes diversity training programs.
A bug in your app causes users to lose data.
Your COO wants to launch a risky international expansion.

choices.feedback: The move impresses markets, if it works.

scenario: You find out your competitor is stealing your ad copy.
Your company mascot goes viral for the wrong reasons.
You receive an anonymous tip about insider trading in your company.

choices.feedback: This may come back to haunt you.

scenario: A viral post accuses your product of being unsafe.

choices.text: Issue a public apology and recall

choices.feedback: Your silence is seen as weakness.

scenario: A celebrity endorses your product unexpectedly.

choices.feedback: The campaign goes viral, boosting sales.
A classy move with subtle rewards.

scenario: Your CFO is pushing for major budget cuts to improve margins.

choices.feedback: Savings are up, but morale crashes.
You're popular, but at a cost.

scenario: A new government regulation increases compliance costs.

choices.feedback: Profit rises, but so does scrutiny.

scenario: Your app is trending with teenagers but not your target market.

choices.feedback: Growth explodes, but your vision blurs.

scenario: A former employee is badmouthing your company on social media.

choices.feedback: The narrative gets out of control.

scenario: Your company is offered a partnership with a government agency.
A scandal from your college days resurfaces.
Your main product is becoming obsolete.

choices.text: Buy a smaller competitor with a new product
Try to extend the product's life
choices.feedback: It feels like clinging to the past.

scenario: A popular podcast accuses your company of unethical practices.

choices.text: Request a chance to respond on-air

choices.feedback: Your silence is seen as guilt.

scenario: A developer proposes open-sourcing a key tool.

choices.feedback: The dev community rallies around you.

scenario: A former employee starts a successful podcast and offers to feature your company.

choices.text: Accept and give them insider stories.
choices.feedback: The episode goes viral. Great PR!

choices.text: Politely decline but support their work.
choices.feedback: They mention you anyway, in a good light.

choices.text: Pay them to promote your brand heavily.
choices.feedback: It's a hit campaign. Worth the investment.

scenario: An intern creates a tool that saves everyone time.

choices.feedback: Your team feels inspired and loyal.

choices.text: Reward the intern with a bonus.
Quietly implement the tool and move on.
choices.feedback: Efficiency increases, but morale gain is missed.

scenario: You are invited to speak at an industry conference.

choices.feedback: Your message spreads across the industry.
The team feels trusted and proud.
Good exposure without needing to speak.

scenario: A local government offers tax breaks for tech training programs.

choices.feedback: Everyone levels up ,  and you save cash.

scenario: A celebrity uses your product and tweets about it.

choices.text: Publicly thank them and offer a free gift.
choices.feedback: The post goes viral. Sales spike.

choices.text: Quietly boost ads around the tweet.

scenario: A national award opens applications for innovative startups.

choices.feedback: Your team admires the quiet focus.

scenario: An employee suggests a wellness week with fun activities.

choices.feedback: Some use it, others appreciate the gesture.

scenario: A major client wants to sign a long-term contract.

choices.feedback: It's a windfall ,  your finances are strong.
You get a better deal. Bold move.

choices.text: Refer them to a partner company.

scenario: Your team finishes a project ahead of schedule.

choices.text: Give everyone a surprise day off.
choices.feedback: A rare gift. Staff morale skyrockets.

choices.text: Roll right into the next project.

scenario: A nonprofit asks to collaborate on a social impact project.

choices.feedback: It's great PR and feels meaningful.
Still helpful, the public appreciates your support.
Not flashy, but useful and sincere.

scenario: An AI your company developed is making biased decisions.

choices.feedback: You gain public trust for responsible behavior.

choices.text: Spin it as a beta test

scenario: A rival company offers to 'merge', but they want majority control.
An employee goes viral for dancing in the office.

choices.feedback: People feel your company is uptight.

scenario: A supplier is exposed for unethical labor practices.
A foreign government bans your product on political grounds.
Your employees want the company to go carbon neutral.
You receive a tip about a startup with disruptive tech.

choices.feedback: You make waves in the industry.
You may have missed the next big thing.

scenario: A documentary criticizes the tech industry, you're mentioned briefly.
Your cafeteria serves only junk food, and staff start complaining.
You're nominated for a leadership award, but it comes from a biased organization.

choices.text: Take the award and redirect attention to your team

scenario: Your office building is infested with mold. Employees want remote work.

choices.feedback: People are grateful for the flexibility.

scenario: A famous hacker offers to test your system for free.

choices.feedback: Security improves and PR is positive.

scenario: A viral trend encourages employees to prank their managers.

choices.feedback: You're seen as a fun boss.

scenario: You're invited to advise a government panel on tech ethics.
Your employees complain about outdated equipment.
A leaked email reveals internal salary gaps.
You're offered a chance to test a new VR workplace tool.
An intern accidentally deletes part of your codebase.

choices.text: Use it as a learning moment

choices.feedback: The team recovers, but it's costly.

scenario: A news site misquotes you in a negative light.

choices.feedback: Your side of the story is heard.
People believe what they saw first.

scenario: Your company's game app is accused of targeting kids with ads.
You turn customer praise into a viral ad campaign without employee consent.

choices.feedback: You do the right thing, but at a cost.
Sales boom, but so do resignations.

scenario: You stage a flashy farewell for a retiring employee, but it looks performative.

choices.text: Apologize and offer a private moment

choices.feedback: The gesture feels hollow to some.

choices.text: Double down and film it for PR
choices.feedback: The public claps, but insiders cringe.

scenario: An intern-led mentorship program goes public, before being vetted.
Your inclusion award is linked to a sponsor with a shady past.

choices.text: Use it to highlight your internal policies

scenario: Your guest lecture at a school is criticized for corporate overreach.

choices.text: Pull out and issue a statement

scenario: You turn your rooftop garden into a branding stunt during a food crisis.

choices.feedback: Profits soar, but so does scrutiny.

scenario: You force the early-finishing team to take on another project, without rest.

choices.text: Give them the break after backlash

scenario: A mural you commission offends part of your workforce.

choices.feedback: Freedom of expression comes at a cost.

choices.text: Add a new mural beside it

scenario: To celebrate 100k users, you release user data insights without consent.
A former employee praises your company whose departure was messy.

choices.text: Remind the public why they left
Use the praise in ads anyway

scenario: You launch a mental health initiative but some say it's performative.

choices.feedback: Some employees feel it's just PR.
People feel seen, but it's not a fix-all.

scenario: You surprise the office with standing desks but not everyone likes change.
You offer generous parental leave that makes single employees feel overlooked.

choices.feedback: You get points for balance, but it's expensive.

choices.text: Highlight the family policy in ads

scenario: You greenlight a community mural with a politically charged design.

choices.text: Modify the design with community input

scenario: You adopt a 4-day work week pilot, investors are uneasy.

choices.text: Expand the pilot and own it

scenario: You host a lavish charity gala, staff aren't invited.

choices.text: Let staff volunteer at the event

choices.feedback: The crowd cheers then asks questions.

scenario: You offer free public Wi-Fi near your HQ, but it causes local disruptions.

choices.feedback: Chaos and clout in equal parts.

scenario: You partner with a trendy brand known for flashy marketing.

choices.text: Limit the collab to one product

scenario: You donate a large tax-deductible sum to an environmental.
You offer stock options to all employees tied to long-term loyalty.

choices.feedback: Some see the vision, others stay skeptical.

scenario: Your company receives a major contract from a corrupt government.

choices.text: Reject the contract and publicly denounce the government
choices.feedback: You gain some praise for standing up.

choices.text: Accept and try to distance yourself from the government
choices.feedback: You're still making money, as a coward.

scenario: A top and essential supplier is caught exploiting child labor.

choices.text: Continue using the supplier and turn a blind eye
choices.feedback: Profits made with severe public backlash.

choices.text: Immediately sever ties and absorb the financial loss
Negotiate with the supplier to improve conditions quietly
choices.feedback: Profits still come at a moral cost.

scenario: An employee with insider informationoffers you a lucrative tip to manipulate stock prices.

choices.text: Use the insider information and profit
choices.feedback: Huge profits but your reputation is ruined.

choices.text: Report the employee and cooperate with authorities
choices.feedback: You avoid trouble and are praised for honesty.

choices.text: Ignore the tip and keep things as is
choices.feedback: The lack of ambition hurts your growth.

scenario: An influential celebrity offers to endorse your product, but they're involved in a major scandal.

choices.text: Accept the endorsement to boost sales
choices.feedback: Sales soar, but public perception of plummets.

choices.text: Turn down the offer and stay clean
choices.feedback: You earn respect for your integrity.

choices.text: Negotiate a endorsement emphasizing their redemption arc
choices.feedback: You position the partnership as a redemption story.

scenario: Your company faces a lawsuit accusing you of lying about a life-saving product.

choices.text: Fight the lawsuit in court and deny any wrongdoing
Settle out of court and pay the victims
choices.feedback: Money lost avoiding the negative press.

choices.text: Admit fault and recall the product
choices.feedback: A financial hit to strengthen your public image.

scenario: A tech giant offers you a deal to implement a highly invasive surveillance system.

choices.text: Accept the deal and integrate the system
Refuse the deal and risk losing market share
choices.feedback: Competitors who accept the deal surge ahead.

choices.text: Negotiate a compromise with the tech giant to reduce the scope
choices.feedback: Your company's privacy policies are gray.

scenario: Your company is under pressure to release a product before it is fully tested.

choices.text: Release the product and capitalize on the hype
choices.feedback: Money flows but the product fails.

choices.text: Delay the product launch and take time to ensure quality
choices.feedback: The product gains you long-term trust.

choices.text: Release a scaled-down version of the product

scenario: Your company is caught using tax loopholes.

choices.text: Defend the loopholes legally and continue business as usual
Publicly announce a voluntary increase in taxes
choices.feedback: You take a financial hit but win back public support.

choices.text: Close the loopholes and put savings into charity
choices.feedback: Your company is willing to give back and repair its image.

scenario: Unethical research leads to a scientific breakthrough that revolutionizes your industry.

choices.text: Go ahead with the breakthrough and profit from it
Abort the research and report to the authorities
choices.feedback: You gain immense respect for doing the right thing.

choices.text: Try to find a way to ethically replicate the breakthrough

scenario: Your company is caught falsifying environmental reports to avoid stricter regulations.

choices.text: Continue the deception and hope the crisis passes
Admit the false reports and fix your environmental impact
choices.feedback: You commit to real environmental change.

choices.text: Hide the truth and blame a lower-level employee
choices.feedback: Your company is a symbol of corporate deceit.

scenario: Your company is asked to develop surveillance technology for an evil government.

choices.feedback: You gain respect for your ethical stance.

scenario: A major shareholder demands that your company cuts costs by reducing employee benefits.

choices.feedback: You save money at a cost.
A compromise that doesn't fully satisfy.

scenario: Your company is accused of using sweatshop labor overseas.

choices.text: Deny the allegations and continue operations
Admit fault and overhaul labor practices
choices.feedback: A costly decision that restores public trust.
An approach that shows commitment to change.

scenario: An activist group targets your company for environmental damage.

choices.text: Launch an aggressive PR campaign to discredit the group
Engage with the activists and commit to environmental reforms
choices.feedback: Your commitment to change is praised.

choices.text: Ignore the activists and continue operations
choices.feedback: Ignoring the issue leads to ongoing criticism.

scenario: Your company is offered a lucrative deal to provide technology for military applications.

choices.feedback: You gain respect for your ethical stance.

choices.text: Negotiate terms to ensure ethical use

scenario: A major scandal reveals that your company's products contain harmful chemicals.

choices.text: Recall the products and issue a public apology
choices.feedback: A costly step to restore public trust.

choices.text: Cover up the issue and continue sales
choices.feedback: Profits remain high, damaging your reputation.

choices.text: Investigate and gradually phase out the chemicals

scenario: Your company is facing a hostile takeover by a larger competitor.

choices.text: Fight the takeover with legal action
Negotiate a merger to retain some control
choices.feedback: A compromise that maintains some control.

scenario: Your company's data collection practices come under scrutiny for privacy violations.

choices.text: Defend your practices and continue as usual
Admit fault and change data practices
choices.feedback: A costly decision that restores public trust.

scenario: Your company is offered a deal to produce a highly addictive product.

choices.feedback: You gain respect for your ethical stance.

choices.text: Negotiate terms to reduce addiction risk
choices.feedback: You compromise, but still face ethical scrutiny.

scenario: A whistleblower exposes your company's involvement in illegal activities.

choices.text: Cover up the activities and discredit the whistleblower
choices.feedback: You maintain profits but damage public trust.

choices.text: Admit fault and cooperate with authorities
choices.feedback: A costly step to restore public trust.

choices.text: Investigate and quietly correct the issues
